Usage

The usage is pretty self explaining.
Include 'jquery.editable.select.min.js'.
The plugin does not need any stylesheet or images.

Transform a select into an editable select: var myEditableSelect = $(".mySelectBox").editableSelect();
The select with the class 'mySelectBox' should now be editable.

Add or delete options myEditableSelect.addOption("I'm a new option");
myEditableSelect.addOption("me too");

myEditableSelect.removeOption("me too");
//you can also remove an option by it's index
To obtain the value of the editable select call it's val() method alert( myEditableSelect.val() );

Example

Example Code

$(function(){
var selectBoxOne = $("#s1").editableSelect();
var selectBoxTwo = $("#s2").editableSelect();
selectBoxTwo.addOption("punches in your face");
selectBoxTwo.removeOption("$ - Dollar");

selectBoxOne.change(function(){
console.log("Option: "+selectBoxOne.val());
});
selectBoxTwo.change(function(){
console.log("Your currency: "+selectBoxTwo.val());
});

//selectBoxOne.restoreSelect();
});
